body.p:
To his excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner Moses Sowards would respectfully represent unto your excellency that at the April term of the Pike circuit court 1849. There was a Judgment of $60.00 obtained against him for keeping a tipling House He states that it is true that he sold the whiskey but not to have the same drank upon the premises or premises adjacent thereto He directed the parties to take the same off of his premises and those adjacent that they took it some distance from his house before they drank it. He never permitted any one to drink and tiple about his house. He states that he is poor with and with all the labour, that he performs he is barely able to suport his family. In consideration of the premises he respectfully asks your excellency to remit.
We believe that the prayer of the petitioner ought to be granted.

John M Fidler
